what: Hypotheses Using Biased and Unbiased Urn Models Inspired by Muriel Bristol and Ronald Fisher
title: Hypotheses Using Biased and Unbiased Urn Models Inspired by Muriel Bristol and Ronald Fisher
text: set functions compute pp-values perform sensitivity analysis, adapting Fisher’s pp-value test case studies process tracing. uses unbiased biased urn models draw null distributions absence randomization.

title: Hypotheses Using Biased and Unbiased Urn Models Inspired by Muriel Bristol and Ronald Fisher
text: name package Dr. Murial Bristol, better known “tea lady” Fisher’s pp-value demonstration. Fewer people aware “lady” fellow researcher Rothamsted Research institute. Beyond brilliant scientist , Dr. Bristol indeed taste whether tea milk poured first cup, evidence suggests.

what: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: observation can either support working theory rival theory, function returns p-value summarizing evidence rival theory provided working theory.

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
code: find_p_two_types(   obs_support,   total_obs,   odds = 1,   weights = NULL,   interpretation = FALSE )

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: obs_support integer representing number observations favor working hypothesis. Must less equal total. total_obs integer representing total number observations made odds odds observing rival versus working-theory observation. can interpreted "bias" observation. "relative ease" observation. interpretation TRUE function returns text helping interpret result, FALSE (default option) returns p-value smoking_gun_weight Double. Additional weight given single observation total.

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: Either p-value (numeric, scalar) list containing p-value text containing interpretation

title: Find a p-value given a certain number of observations in favor of the working hypothesis among a total number of observations when there are two types of observations — find_p_two_types
text: function accomodates urns working theory supporting observations systematically easier difficulty observe rival supporting observations (odds) currently also supports designs one observation total supporting working theory  particularly compelling ("smoking gun"). example, observation 1 worth 2 observations, urn can reflect increasing number observations supporting rival theory urn, accounting weight smoking gun observation.

what: Sensitivity analysis for simple urn models — sens_urn
title: Sensitivity analysis for simple urn models — sens_urn
text: function allows researcher calculate p-value arising urn probability drawing rival supporting observation equal probability drawing working-theory supporting observation.

title: Sensitivity analysis for simple urn models — sens_urn
Sensitivity analysis for simple urn models — sens_urn
text: obs_support integer representing number observations favor working hypothesis. Must less equal total. obs_oppose integer representing number observations working hypothesis. Must less equal total. total_obs integer representing total number observations thep decimal (Double). p-value threshold. Default p=.05.

title: Sensitivity analysis for simple urn models — sens_urn
text: p-value given amount bias drawing observations urn.

what: Simulate draws from an urn model — sim_urn
title: Simulate draws from an urn model — sim_urn
Simulate draws from an urn model — sim_urn
Simulate draws from an urn model — sim_urn
text: urn_size Total number items urn total_obs integer representing total number observations thep p-value threshold

title: Simulate draws from an urn model — sim_urn
Simulate draws from an urn model — sim_urn
text: function allows researcher simulate draws urn models nice analytical expressions. example, urn models ball different probability drawn. Given set draws, can calculate probabilities.
